title: Addendum to “Targeting Meritocracy”
summary:
Key ideas
- Scott is dissatisfied with the responses that his post "Targeting Meritocracy" received.
- The different perspectives on conflict theory and mistake theory.
- Meritocracy promotes the smartest and most competent people.

Key learnings
- The difference between conflict theory and mistake theory.
- Meritocracy does not necessarily promote class interests.
- Basic assumptions play a significant role in disagreements.

Key questions
- What is the difference between conflict theory and mistake theory?
- Can meritocracy promote class interests?
- How do basic assumptions affect disagreements?
